Skewness and kurtosis have no linear relation with the shape parameter. So when using equality of skewness and/or kurtosis in finding the best match between a distribution and a sample there are two complications. - An iterative approximation loop is required. - A solution is not guaranteed
Skewness and kurtosis are only influenced by shape parameters, location an scale parameters do not influence them. This property makes it possible to first find for a distribution the correct shape parameter, and then shift and stretch the distribution to the correct mean and deviation.
As can be seen on the 'How to find an approximate function page', sometimes demanding equal mean, deviation and skewness, and sometimes demanding equal mean, deviation and kurtosis seems better.
